title: Japana Lake
about: Japana Lake - the largest oxbow (Narionali) lake in Georgia, Lanchkhuti Municipality. It is located in the Guria lowlands, at an altitude of 13 meters above sea level. The lake was formed as a result of a change in the river bed. The abandoned winding section of the river is called an oxbow lake, and the water inside is called a meandering lake.
